intro: Arachniodes ishingensis, commonly known as the Ishingi fern, is a rare and delicate fern species native to Japan. It belongs to the family Athyriaceae and is characterized by its finely divided, arching fronds that give it a delicate, spider-like appearance. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Its leaves are bioluminescent, a unique trait that aids in attracting nocturnal pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
